fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25664].
  {panel}

some things that would make the gallery macro better:

the image attached to the page has a comment field.  when a comment is provided, it is used as both the caption for the photo in the gallery and for the tooltip that you get when hovering over the photo in the gallery.

but having the filename of the image would also be useful for example when the gallery has 300 images and you want to download the JPG from the attachments.

i'd suggest that the filename be placed into the tooltip regardless of whether the attachment comment is populated.

the gallery macro would benefit from a parameter that controls whether or not captions are shown.

then, if the comment is not populated, the filename be used as the caption.  if the comment field is there, it could take precedence over the filename as the caption.

in addition, it would be hugely helpful to be able to link from an image in the gallery.  not sure where that would go, except possibly on the comment field of the attachment.  

perhaps another gallery macro parameter could control whether the comment field is used for a URL or for a caption.  or if you detect a URL in the comment, make that the link for the gallery image rather than assuming we want to see the full size image when clicking.
fields.summary: gallery macro suggested improvements
Remove previousContext and originalContext from PageContext

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25661].
  {panel}

Confluence shipped a while ago with Autoconvert - the ability to convert pasted links into macros or other thinks.

I've found that on quite a few team homepages on EAC or customers, they often have a pasted link there to a GreenHopper Rapidboard..

We should extend autoconvert to support this. So a pasted link like this:
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=218

Turns into: "Team Calendars Development"
fields.summary: Support GreenHopper RapidBoard links for AutoConvert

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25659].
  {panel}

 While the editor is great, memory consumption on the browser side is unreasonably large in Chrome.  If the user only edits once or twice during the life of the browser process, then it's okay.  But if you're doing lots of content creation or editing, and therefore using the editor quite a bit, the memory consumption eventually becomes so great that system resources become an issue.

I can demonstrate this problem by going to any page and clicking Edit, then cancelling to leave the editor.  Each time I do this, my Chrome process grows fairly dramatically.   

In an effort to put some numbers around it, I did some testing and created a spreadsheet, and from that I created a chart (attached).   The chart illustrates memory consumption (in MB) on IE vs Chrome, for successive editing sessions of the exact same page (a simple page that fits "above the fold")

That exercise made me realize that the problem is not _quite_ as bad as I thought, because the memory consumption does seem to level off in Chrome on a simple test, in which the same page is being edited again and again.

It would take me more time than I have right now to do a comprehensive test of a more realistic scenario, but I can assure you that, when you're editing multiple pages, and using multiple browser windows or tabs, you eventually start to get some amazing memory consumption -- around half a GB for a single process.   This definitely becomes noticeable.  And I'm not talking about hundreds of pages over the course of many hours.  Just a dozen or so pages for an hour or two,  a fairly normal amount of work for an active editor.

The memory consumption in Chrome is spectacular enough that I was certain this issue would already exist in JIRA.  I looked for one pretty hard, but did not find one.  If this turns out to be a duplicate, I apologize.
fields.summary: Significant Memory Consumption in Chrome while Editing

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a page and insert a really large table with a lot of data in it, such that the table takes up the entire page and more (vertically). Example:
!pageissue.jpg!
# Try to select from the top left edge of the table, and drag it down to select the entire table:
!pageissue2.jpg!

Notice that the page does not scroll to the bottom (not able to mark more rows), and because of that, you are not able to select the entire table. 

h3.Workaround
Use the mouse wheel to scroll to the bottom while clicking (selecting the table rows) with the mouse's left click.
fields.summary: Large Tables cause Drag Select issue in Edit Mode with IE

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page
# Edit the page and insert a link e.g. https://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=confluenc*&where=CONFKB
# Linking does not work when the link contains *

Issue occurred in these browsers (as tested):
- Internet Explorer
- Chrome
- Firefox

As referred here: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt
{quote}
  Usually a URL has the same interpretation when an octet is
   represented by a character and when it encoded. However, this is not
   true for reserved characters: encoding a character reserved for a
   particular scheme may change the semantics of a URL.

   Thus, only alphanumerics, the special characters "$-_.+!*'(),", and
   reserved characters used for their reserved purposes may be used
   unencoded within a URL.

{quote}

h5.Workaround:
Replace * with %2A e.g. https://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=confluenc%2A&where=CONFKB and linking will work.
fields.summary: Insert Link Containing * Doesn't Work

fields.description:
A user was editing a lot of Pages across multiple Spaces. Eventually he noticed on the dashboard-updates that some Pages he did not view, edit or move also received a revision version update credited to him (i.e. "edited by user"). 

Upon inspecting the offending Pages and viewing the changes he apparently made, the new version had zero changes from the old version. Other users who were managing those Pages are concerned whether their content is being modified without warning from this user especially since he was not meant to (and didn't) touch those Pages.
fields.summary: New Page Revision with no content changes by user who did not even access Page
Relative Linking broken in 4.x

fields.description:
h4. Problem

When synchronising a Confluence User Directory that is connected to JIRA, groups do not transfer across due to discrepancies between the {{user_name}} (mixed case).

h4. To Recreate

# *JIRA:* Add a new user to JIRA Internal Directory. This user will be enforced lowercase, e.g.: {{joe.bloggs@example.com}}.
# *JIRA:* Create several groups and add that user to those groups, e.g.: {{Sample Group}}.
# *Confluence:* Connect Confluence to JIRA for User Management. The synchronisation will create a User Directory in Confluence with a lower case user.
# *JIRA:* Add a LDAP connection to JIRA to fetch the same user, however in mixed case, e.g.: {{Joe.Bloggs@example.com}} from an external LDAP/AD.
# *Confluence:* Synchronise the JIRA Server User Directory. At this point it should fail with an error like the below:
{noformat:title=atlassian-confluence.log}
2012-06-05 12:06:50,354 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-7] [crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembershipDao] addAllUsersToGroup joe.bloggs@example.com into Sample Group
2012-06-05 12:06:50,355 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-7] [crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateMembershipDao] addAllUsersToGroup Please try to resolve any errors with these users and groups, and try again.
2012-06-05 12:06:50,355 WARN [scheduler_Worker-7] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] addUserMembershipsForGroup Could not add the following missing users to group [Sample Group ]: [joe.bloggs@example.com]
{noformat}

I believe this is to do with differences between the {{cwd_user.user_name}}, maybe it's not using {{cwd_user.lower_user_name}}?

h4. Workaround

Remove the Confluence 'JIRA Server' User Directory and add it again. When it is added again, it will create the users with the same case as the LDAP/AD directory in JIRA.
fields.summary: Mixed case usernames can break connection between Confluence and JIRA for User Management

fields.description:
The Confluence 4.2 jar exposes a dependency on the javax.resource:connector artifact, which is not available via any public maven repository due to licensing restrictions. 

This makes it difficult for an external developer to build plugins against Confluence 4.2, as they may not have this artifact in their local maven repository.  Atlassian developers are unaffected by this problem because we can keep the artifact within the _private_ Atlassian repository without breaking any re-distribution rules.

Trying to compile a Confluence plugin against Confluence 4.2 with a clean maven repo generates the following error:

{code:lang=none}
6694K downloaded  (confluence-4.2.jar)
Downloading: https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/public/com/atlassian/confluence/confluence-upgrade/4.2/confluence-upgrade-4.2.jar
99K downloaded  (crowd-api-2.4.0-rc1.jar)
Downloading: https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/public/com/atlassian/crowd/crowd-integration-client-rest/2.4.0-rc1/crowd-integration-client-rest-2.4.0-rc1.jar
26K downloaded  (confluence-upgrade-4.2.jar)
Downloading: https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/public/com/atlassian/confluence/confluence-bucket/4.2/confluence-bucket-4.2.jar
60K downloaded  (crowd-integration-client-rest-2.4.0-rc1.jar)
117K downloaded  (confluence-bucket-4.2.jar)
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] BUILD ERROR
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Unable to execute mojo

Embedded error: Missing:
----------
1) javax.resource:connector:jar:1.5

  Try downloading the file manually from the project website.

  Then, install it using the command: 
      mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=javax.resource -DartifactId=connector -Dversion=1.5 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file

  Alternatively, if you host your own repository you can deploy the file there: 
      mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=javax.resource -DartifactId=connector -Dversion=1.5 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]

  Path to dependency: 
  	1) com.atlassian.confluence.ext:newcode-macro-plugin:atlassian-plugin:2.0.13-SNAPSHOT
  	2) com.atlassian.confluence:confluence:jar:4.2
  	3) hibernate:hibernate:jar:2.1.8-atlassian-12
  	4) javax.resource:connector:jar:1.5

----------
1 required artifact is missing.

for artifact: 
  com.atlassian.confluence.ext:newcode-macro-plugin:atlassian-plugin:2.0.13-SNAPSHOT

from the specified remote repositories:
  atlassian-plugin-sdk (file:///Users/jaysee/Dev/atlassian-plugin-sdk-3.9.2/repository),
  central (http://repo1.maven.org/maven2),
  atlassian-public (https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/public)


[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] For more information, run Maven with the -e switch
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time: 34 seconds
[INFO] Finished at: Mon Jun 04 14:21:16 PDT 2012
[INFO] Final Memory: 55M/110M
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
{code}


This is a pretty unpleasant experience for external developers - they now must find a copy of the connector jar and install it manually in their local maven repo. For someone who is unfamiliar with maven, this may even prove to be an insurmountable obstacle without assistance.

Confluence 4.1 did not have this problem.

How can we fix this?
fields.summary: External developers are unable to compile plugins against Confluence 4.2

fields.description:
After upgrading to Confluence 4.2.4 pages including the popular label heatmap and space labels overview page take a very long time to load while MySQL is running on a high load proceeding the statement:
{code:language=sql}
select label5_.LABELID as LABELID, label5_.NAME as NAME, label5_.OWNER as OWNER, label5_.NAMESPACE as NAMESPACE, label5_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION5_, label5_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD6_, label5_.LABELID as x0_0_, count(label5_.LABELID) as x1_0_ from CONTENT spaceconte0_, SPACES space1_, CONTENT_LABEL labelling2_ left outer join ATTACHMENTS attachment3_ on labelling2_.ATTACHMENTID=attachment3_.ATTACHMENTID left outer join CONTENT contentent4_ on labelling2_.CONTENTID=contentent4_.CONTENTID, LABEL label5_ where spaceconte0_.CONTENTTYPE in ('com.atlassian.confluence.pages.AbstractPage', 'USERSTATUS', 'PAGE', 'BLOGPOST', 'CUSTOM', 'MAIL', 'SPACEDESCRIPTION', 'com.atlassian.confluence.core.SpaceContentEntityObject') and labelling2_.LABELID=label5_.LABELID and ((label5_.NAMESPACE='global'  and labelling2_.LABELID=label5_.LABELID)and((contentent4_.CONTENTID=spaceconte0_.CONTENTID )or(attachment3_.PAGEID=spaceconte0_.CONTENTID ))and(spaceconte0_.SPACEID=space1_.SPACEID )and(lower(space1_.SPACEKEY)='leitung' )and((attachment3_.ATTACHMENTID is not null )or(contentent4_.CONTENT_STATUS!='deleted' ))) group by  label5_.LABELID , label5_.NAMESPACE , label5_.OWNER , label5_.NAME , label5_.LASTMODDATE , label5_.CREATIONDATE order by  count(label5_.LABELID)DESC limit 25
{code}

Actually we have the following number of records in the involved tables:
|| CONTENT_LABEL | 5.105 records |
|| ATTACHMENTS | 4.777 records |
|| CONTENT | 23.891 records |
|| SPACES | 24 |

For avoiding this performance issues I had to remove all label heatmaps from the Home pages but cause I can't disable the label overview and we work quite a lot with labels I urgently need a bug fix for this.
fields.summary: Rendering labels heatmap or space labels overview needs high mysql performance and leads to a timeout

fields.summary: Progress bar loads forever in Confluence gadget in JIRA to show page with @Mentions, when hovering over mention

fields.description:
When the user import a page from a different wiki that is not from Atlassian and then include a table of contents , all the links point back to the old wiki. If I create a new table of contents all of the links seem to point to the top of the page rather than the header that they should. 
We tested and removed the headers that are not working and added new headers and it seems to work  but if we added more headers without removing the old headers the problem persists. It seems a malfunction in TOC if we import from a different Wiki.
fields.summary: Cannot Create Tables of Contents for imported pages from a different wiki

fields.description:
When exporting a page to PDF and it contains an HTML macro with a numbered list, it breaks the number replacing with 1. Please see the both screenshot. Here is the HTML macro content to replicate the issue: {code}
  1. test test test test test testtest test test test test testtest test test test test testtest test test test test testtest test test test test test
{code}
fields.summary: PDF export doesn't honour the content of HTML macro when it has numbered list

fields.description:
Reproduce the bug:
* Configure the doctheme globally in the admin console:
** Write some text for the navigation, the header and the footer (e.g. global navi, global header, global footer)
* In a space select "Global Look and Feel" as the theme.
* Visit a page in that space. You see the texts which are configured globally. (/)
* In the same space switch to the doctheme and configure the three text boxes, this time pick something like _local navigation_, etc.
* Visit a page in that space again. You see the texts which are configured in that space. (/)
* Go back to the space administration and switch the theme back to "Global Look and Feel".
* Again, visit a page in this space. The text for the navigation and the footer are the ones configured globally *but the text for the header is still the one configured for that space.* (-)
fields.summary: Documentation Theme shows header configured in space instead of the one configured globally

fields.description:
According to [this doc from w3|http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/global.html#h-7.5.2], the "element id" must be unique: {quote} This attribute assigns a name to an element. This name must be unique in a document. {quote} Confluence is not making this unique at the moment. So the following wiki markup: {code} h1. title 1 h3. subtitle a h3. subtitle b h1. title 2 h3. subtitle a h3. subtitle b {code} Will result in the following: {code}

title 1

subtitle a

subtitle a

title 2

subtitle a

subtitle a

{code} The subtitles are not made unique, which is not following the standard.
fields.summary: ID must be unique following the HTML 4 standard
Make page import from disk available for OnDemand customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25630].
  {panel}

Use case:
User management with two different directories, one housing the "company users" one housing the "external employee" users.

In cases, where the status for the employment changes (i.e. user now works for company or former emlpoyee now works as freelancer) it would be nice to tell Confluence, that a given user is moved between directories. 
Thus, Confluence keeps the internal stored permissions, but gets the user information and credentials from the new directory.
fields.summary: Make it possible to move users between directories

fields.description:
Despite being bundled with both Confluence v4.0.7 and v4.1.10, (the versions recently released in response to this recent security alert), it is no longer possible to display embedded files such as .PDFs, .DOCs and .PPTs.

When trying to display the embedded content, the macro will just hang indefinitely, as shown in the attached screenshot.

Confluence v3.5.16 doesn't appear to be affected by this issue in the way that the other two security releases are.
fields.summary: Bundled version of Office Connector not compatible with Confluence v4.0.7 and v4.1.10

fields.description:
When creating a blog post in 3.5 confluence would politely state:

{noformat}
The following error(s) occurred:
- You can not create two blog-posts on the same day with the same title.
{noformat}

However now in 4.2.4 (prior 4.x untested) you get a nasty exception and stack-trace of:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DuplicateDataRuntimeException: A page already exists with the title Test Blog in the space with key ds
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.throwIfDuplicateAbstractPageTitle(DefaultPageManager.java:904) 
{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*:

# Go to demonstration space
# Create new blog post called "Test Blog"
# Create another blog post called "Test Blog"
# Click "Preview"
# Click "Save"
fields.summary: Confluence 4.2.4 raises system error when blog post name exists on creation

Thank you for your help.

Regards,
JP Support
fields.summary: When you enter Japanese comment on Chrome, the first letter appears in alphabet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25624].
  {panel}

When you have a conflict in the Confluence editor, the screen includes a complete diff of the changes, a warning box as well as the editor. The layout is completely broken, and the reduction in the height of the editor and the fact that the content can expand larger than the screen makes it basically impossible to use, even on a really large screen.

We've still got the old way the editor UI worked, but that doesn't really work any more. The old UI didn't have a limited height for the edit page, so the diff appeared in full and it just pushed the editor down. The current situation with a tiny area to view the diff and a restricted edit height is a big problem.

See attached screenshot.

We need to do something better than this, but I'm not sure exactly what. Perhaps we could display the diff in a dialog when the user clicks a button, rather than putting it in the page directly.
fields.summary: Editor conflict screen is laid out badly, very hard to use

fields.description:
Search can not find child pages either when trying to link to page or just general searching

Steps to Reproduce
1) Create a new space
2) Create Child Pages in that Space (child 1, child2)
navigate to each page and add some content and save
navigated back to original page and enter edit mode
3)add text child1 child 2
4)highlight child1 and select link 
5) Search for child1 in link to ui
no results returned
6) search for child 2
not results returned
7) select Recently Viewed tab and find both child pages
select appropriate.
save

Alternate .. create child1 and Child 2 pages
and try general Search mechanism from any page .. pages will not be found.
page containing the text child1 will be found
fields.summary: Can not find child pages via Search

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce: # Go to Browse > Confluence admin > User Macro # Create a User Macro # On the template field, add the following code: {code} ## Macro title: My Macro ## Macro has a body: Y or N ## Body processing: Selected body processing option ## Output: Selected output option ## ## Developed by: My Name ## Date created: dd/mm/yyyy ## Installed by: My Name ## This is an example macro ## @param Name:title=Name|type=string|required=true|desc=Your name ## @param Colour:title=Favourite #set ($helper = $action.helper)

GOOGLE
View Online: http://google.com/x/$helper.tinyUrl

$body
{code} # Save it # Now in a new page, type {name_macro, that should auto-populate. # Save it, then go to Tools > Export to PDF # You should get this string in the PDF: {{http://google.com/x/$helper.tinyUrl}} h3.Workaround: You can do that manually, avoiding the User Macro.
fields.summary: User Macro with TinyURL do not render in PDF/Word export

fields.description: When using a code macro block in a page that contains fifty or more lines the format when exporting to PDF is incorrect.  At fifty lines, an extra blank page is added to the beginning of the exported PDF.  At fifty five lines, a different but similar issue occurs where a page return is added mid-macro.  Please see attached PDF's for examples.  This occurs when using version 2.5.6 of the PDF export plugin.
fields.summary: Format errors when using PDF export and large code macro block

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create 200 issues in JIRA
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence
# Create a [JIRA Issues Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro] in Confluence page
# The macro does not create pages even though the render mode Dynamic is used

According to the documentation:
{quote}
* dynamic– dynamic issue display with the following features:
** Click the column headers to sort the output.
** Drag and drop the columns into a different order.
** Temporarily remove a column from the display.
** View a page of issues at a time, for faster response times. 
{quote}
There should be multiple pages created when there is a lot of issues.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro does not create Pages when using render mode Dynamic

fields.description:
There is no way to add an user to a task from the search option.

+Repro stepts:+
# Go to a page with a dynamic task list
# Click on the _arrow_ to display the information of the task
# Click on the user icon. The user search window will open
# Search and user. Check it and click on select users

+Observed bug+
The user is added to the _Assigned To_ field, but there is no way you can save the changes. When you reload the page, the change is not persistent.

If you click the edit button before you start the process, the save button has no effect at all and changes are still not persistent.
fields.summary: Dynamic task list can't add users from searh

fields.description: When using the "Quote" option for text, the text inside the quote box is Italic. However it is NOT marked as Italic text by the Italic button in the tools menu. So when you select some text inside the Quote block and then turn on Italic text (click on Italic button in the tool menu). It will make text non-italic instead.
fields.summary: When using Quote as font-style, the Italic button behaves reversed.

fields.description:
h5. Issue descriptions

Using page layout with header section, columns and footer section.
Putting a panel in the header adds an unneeded empty line below the
panel. This line can be removed by deleting in the editor.
After the save the page looks good.
However if a user afterwards just opens page in the editor and saves it
the empty line will be added again.
This is annoying!

h5. Steps to reproduce

#Create a page, add a info box in the "header cell" and remove the empty line below. Save.
#Showing the correct rendering.
#Opening the page in the new editor. The empty line appears again below the info box. Now just save...
#Showing the now existing empty line.

h5. Screenshot

!Selection_033.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Editor adds unneeded extra line below panel
Status macro is different colour in the edit page screen than on a page

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Go to any space and create a new page
# Attach the following PPT file (with special characters)
!Chinese_Character_Garbled.ppt!
# Edit the page
# Insert "Other Macros" -> Choose "Office Powerpoint" -> Select the file just uploaded -> Save it 
# Wait for a few seconds for the Powerpoint slides presentation to load
# Special characters are garbled
|

I am not sure if this is a Confluence or an Office Connector problem. If this is an Office Connector problem, I will move this bug to OFFCONN project.
fields.summary: 2 byte Characters are garbled in viewfile macro when viewing in PPT slides
Add plugin Table of Contents 2.5.12 for Confluence OnDemand in order to fix TOC and Dynamic Tasklist macros

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce (I have only tried this on OnDemand):*
# Create 2 users, 'fred1' and 'fred2'
# Hit https://instance/wiki/rest/prototype/1/search/user.json?query=fred until both users come back in the result.
# Delete user fred2.
# Hit https://instance/wiki/rest/prototype/1/search/user.json?query=fred a few times - observe an HTTP 500 response instead of the search result.

This breaks sharing, which relies on REST search calls, and persists across re-indexes and restarts.

This issue was encountered by an OnDemand customer. The only workaround I found was to modify/remove the lingering USERINFO entry associated with the deleted user in the {{content}} table, and then re-index.

Note that the exception that provokes the HTTP 500 is not logged out-of-the-box, due to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/REST-198. The problem is an NPE when building a PersonalInformationContentEntity:

{noformat}

 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/confluence/setup/setupstandarddb.action | url: /confluence/setup/setupstandarddb.action | userName: anonymous | action: setupstandarddb
2012-05-30 17:40:45,138 ERROR [http-8080-4] [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaExport] execute ERROR: relation "content" already exists
{noformat}

This is followed by a series of other errors about schema creation failing.

  {panel}

I like the task list, which is bundled with confluence. But to improve its usability I lack some features. 

I need a switch (button, checkbox, link) that hides finished tasks. I do not want to see them. It would be fine to show only open, only finished and both tasks.

Both finished and open tasks looks same, they can be distinguised only by the state of their checkboxes. So I propose to put CSS styles for finished tasks and make it by default italic/grey.

There are many other features, that would boost productivity of this feature. For example add labels to each task, filters by tasks, deadlines .. But for now I will be happy with hiding finished tasks.

 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/confluence/setup/setupstandarddb-start.action?database=postgresql | url: /confluence/setup/setupstandarddb.action | userName: anonymous
2012-05-30 14:30:04,325 WARN [http-8080-4] [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] resolveDependencies Cannot find web resource module for: confluence.aui.staging:dark-features
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/confluence/setup/setupstandarddb-start.action?database=postgresql | url: /confluence/setup/setupstandarddb.action | userName: anonymous
2012-05-30 14:30:04,326 WARN [http-8080-4] [atlassian.plugin.webresource.DefaultResourceDependencyResolver] resolveDependencies Cannot find web resource module for: confluence.aui.staging:storage-manager
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/confluence/setup/setupstandarddb-start.action?database=postgresql | url: /confluence/setup/setupstandarddb.action | userName: anonymous
{noformat}

These do not indicate a problem, so we should remove them.

The cause of this issue is that the aui-staging plugin is not available in the setup plugin system. The setup decorator, {{setup.vmd}}, has the following line:

{noformat}
    #requireResource("com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs")
{noformat}

This resource has a dependency on the {{confluence.aui.staging}} modules:

{noformat}
        <!-- Resources that are in the process of being added to AUI -->
        <dependency>confluence.aui.staging:meta</dependency>
        <dependency>confluence.aui.staging:dark-features</dependency>
        <dependency>confluence.aui.staging:storage-manager</dependency>
{noformat}

We need to either load this plugin in the setup bundled plugins library, or move these dependencies elsewhere.

fields.description:
This issue occurs when trying to insert an attachment after copying a page that contains attachments. The "Insert Link" box in the Rich-Text Editor shows all attachments with the same name. If the page is copied once, the attachments listed in the Editor are shown twice. If the page is copied twice, the attachments listed in the Editor are shown thrice, and so on.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Copy a page that contains one or more attachments by clicking *Tools > Copy*
# Click "Attachments" in the Rich Text Editor. You will see that each attachment in the list has a duplicate with the same name

The attachments can be viewed/accessed without any problems and they are shown in the page only once (as expected).

*Workaround:*
You need to save the page first and edit again. The attachments will only be shown once.

Only occurs in 4.2 onwards
fields.summary: Copying a page with attachments results in attachments shown twice

One very interesting feature in confluence is admin delegation for spaces. And we use it a lot. But while a space admin may configure security/permissions based on users identity or group membership, he doesn't have the ability to modify any group. This leads to use alternatives such as:

 - do the thing with individual people instead of groups

I think local groups with space scope would be a nice improvement and would be really usefull.

fields.description:
Hi -

Our company performed an upgrade to 4.1.9 maybe a month ago.  With that upgrade, links to Hansoft broke.  Instead of an underlined link, the upgrade removed the underline and placed the URL to the side of the link text in parenthesis.  For example:

My Link Text (hansoft://blah.com:111/Task/222)

The raw editor was removed with one of the upgrades, so I used the WYSIWYG to repair the link.  While initially in "Edit mode", I could left-click the link and I navigate by clicking the "Goto link" button.  But once I saved the page, I could never click on the link for navigation purposes again.

To be clear - this behavior used to work fine in a previous version of Confluence.

I feel that the root of the problem is that Confluence does not recognize "hansoft://" as a valid URL/link prefix.

I am seeking three actions:
1. A permanent fix to the issue where Confluence tries to interpret the link prefix incorrectly.  Not just for "hansoft://", but any kind of link prefix.
2. A manual suggested workaround, if there is one.
3. A script to run on our existing Confluence to repair these links.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25571].
  {panel}

Allow page names to be duplicated within a space - Either by including the parent page within the URL or by some other automagic feature. 

This becomes a problem when you have, say a development space layed out as such.

 - Development (space) 
  - Q1 Foobar (project Q1 Parent) 
   - Standards
   - Design
  - Q2 Foobar (project Q2 Parent)
   - Standards
   - Design

for the time being we've adopted the suggestion here:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/8969/how-to-handle-unique-page-names-in-confluence 

But this seems cludgy and like something that should be handled by confluence itself

Thanks! :D

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25570].
  {panel}

What should happen is that all applications in ondemand need to use a
global colour scheme with specific application colour settings also in
there. Currently on JIRA has a global colour scheme working.

Confluence only has a per space colour scheme and not global. Its just less
noticeable due to the ondemand banner that makes it look like a global
colour. Most of the other stuff, e.g. text link and text highlight arent
respected in Confluence. If this currently isnt available, please raise the
relevant bugs. Thanks.

fields.description:
Users that should have no access to restricted pages that adopt restrictions from the parent page are able to upload attachments if they know the page ID.

How to reproduce:
1. Create 2 users, user1 and user2
2. Create a page with user1 and set the page view and edit restrictions to "Me"
3. Create a subpage to this page with user1
4. Correct: Subpage inherits the restrictions, so no one else but user1 can see both pages
5. Send a POST request with user2 to /pages/attachfile.action with a file and the content ID of the parent page
6. Correct: An error occurs because user2 has no permissions to upload attachments
7. Send the same POST request to the content ID of the subpage
8. File is being attached to page :-O

Testet with Confluence 4.2 and 3.5.13
fields.summary: User can upload attachments to restricted pages that adopt restrictions from parent page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25556].
  {panel}

If you attach an outdated database to a newer Confluence instance (app + home directory) the upgrade tasks don't get run.

This is because the com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.needUpgrade() check will pass, since the WEB-INF/lib/confluence-<version>.jar:com/atlassian/confluence/default.properties:build.number equals the build number from the confluence.cfg.xml:buildNumber element in the home directory.

There is a com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.impl.DefaultUpgradeManager.getDatabaseBuildNumber() which is a _select max(BUILDNUMBER) from CONFVERSION_. As far as I can see this is only used to decide to run DatabaseUpgradeTasks (_com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.executeUpgradeStep(List<UpgradeTask>, UpgradeStep)_).

Using the database build number for a sanity check would be unsatisfactory since it is only set after a specific task is run, so I guess we need an additional place for that.
fields.summary: Add a sanity check for preventing the usage of an outdated database with a newer home directory / webapp
